;;经济学人智库;数据表明民主的哪些方面最薄弱。总分分为五个类别，每个类别的评分范围为 1 到 10（见图 2）。尽管特朗普毫无根据地声称 2016 年和 2020 年选举中有选民欺诈，但美国在举行合法选举的能力方面仍然得分很高。 （尽管拜登就职前发生了支持特朗普的叛乱，但美国还是得到了自己投票支持的总统。）在政治参与（即选民投票率）、选举过程和多元化（即自由和公平的选举）方面，美国得分约为九分十个。

;相反，美国的政治文化和政府运作构成了最大的问题。在文化类别中，美国在政治两极分化和对民主的普遍支持方面得分较低。皮尤民意调查机构最近的一项调查发现，超过四分之一的美国人认为独裁政体（领导人可以绕过国会和法院）将是一种某种程度上或非常好的政府形式。
; < br>;在政府职能方面，美国的得分因对民选官员的不信任和对腐败的看法而受到影响。皮尤研究中心的同一项调查发现，超过 80% 的受访者认为大多数政治人物“不关心”“像我这样的人怎么想”。在完全民主的瑞典，只有 43% 的人这么认为。国会在重大问题上陷入僵局，例如;控制边境;和;援助乌克兰;，可能会损害美国人的信任感。

;两极分化和不信任是相互关联的：美国选民对日益极端的候选人的选票日益分裂。这让大多数选民在任何特定时间都认为政府是由不符合其最佳利益的人领导的。只有 40% 的温和派表示，美国有一个政党代表他们的观点。

;;G;;REG德克萨斯州州长阿博特本周见证了他的国家移民政策梦想成为现实。 3 月 19 日，美国最高法院裁定，德克萨斯州可以（至少暂时）强制执行;参议院法案 4; (;SB;4)，一项法律将移民在合法入境口岸之间越过德克萨斯州与墨西哥边境的行为定为犯罪行为（见地图）。该法案赋予当地警察逮捕涉嫌非法进入美国的人的权力，并授权州法官下令驱逐出境。这是州第一次拥有这些权力，这些权力原本是留给联邦政府的。

;

;但艾伯特先生的胜利持续时间较短超过九个小时。最高法院的紧急裁决只是权宜之计，将 ;SB;4 的合法性问题提交给该地区的联邦上诉法院第五巡回上诉法院。当晚，新奥尔良的三名法官决定搁置该法律，并在未来几周内审议该法律的优点。那些担心 ;SB;4 会针对拉丁裔的移民倡导者松了口气。阿博特先生说，他感觉自己好像在观看一场网球拉力赛。

;;
;;
;

;艾伯特先生认为乔·拜登的移民政策过于宽松。基于这一信念，他选择了一场法律斗争，以决定哪一级政府有权控制边境政策。一月份，拜登政府就;SB;4起诉德克萨斯州，称其违反了宪法的至高无上条款，该条款使联邦政府成为移民政策的主要仲裁者。德克萨斯州认为它正在受到移民的“入侵”。在此基础上，它声称自己有权根据美国宪法的州战争条款进行自卫——该条款禁止各州在未经国会同意的情况下发动战争，除非它们“实际上被入侵”或处于“迫在眉睫的危险”。德克萨斯州总检察长肯·帕克斯顿 (Ken Paxton) 表示，他希望促使最高法院重新审视其 2012 年在;亚利桑那州诉美国;一案中的判决，该判决开创了各州无法强制执行自己法律的先例移民制度。法律专家预计，;SB;4 的合宪性问题将在未来几个月内重新回到九名法官手中。

;
;
;< div id="econ-1" class="adComponent_adcontainer__dO1Zm">;
;
;
;

;说服法院德克萨斯州的律师必须证明两件事。首先，移民构成了足够的威胁，有理由向他们宣战。其次，德克萨斯州可以凌驾于联邦法律之上以保护自己。那会很难。加利福尼亚州、纽约州和宾夕法尼亚州的上诉法院将宪法中提到的入侵解释为政敌或外国武装部队的武装敌对。很难想象寻求庇护者如何符合这种描述。最高法院还认为，如果联邦政府对此类入侵做出反应，各州必须“屈服”于联邦政策。这表明，尽管得克萨斯州厌恶拜登政府的边境政策，但实际上该政策的存在是反对国家计划合宪性的论点。

;

;;SB;4 的大胆使其合法不稳定。与州长之前将移民运送到民主党控制的城市或沿格兰德河安装铁丝网以防止移民过河相比，这是一种更大的国家权力灵活性。万一他成功执行自己的移民计划，阿博特先生将不得不应对国内政治以外的问题。墨西哥外交部3月19日表示，该国不会接受被德克萨斯州驱逐出境的移民。它承诺只与美国联邦政府进行谈判。

;

;《麻烦》讲述了他混乱的童年和在耶鲁大学的时光。以及这一切让他思考美国的分裂。根据他的经验，亨德森先生创造了“奢侈信仰”的概念，他将其描述为“一系列以极低的成本赋予上层阶级地位，同时给下层阶级带来成本的信仰”。

;

;过去，人们通过做一些劳动者不会做的“高尔夫或猎犬”之类的事情来展示自己的上层阶级身份。时间去做，或者通过他们的物质装备。但如今，每个人都更容易享受休闲时光和奢侈品，因此精英阶层越来越难以将自己与民众区分开来。他们的解决方案？ “富人已经将社会地位与商品脱钩，并将其重新与信仰联系在一起。”

;

;亨德森先生举了支持取消警察经费的例子。这个想法在;乔治·弗洛伊德的2020年发生的谋杀案;受到许多富人的拥护。然而，对于穷人来说，这是一项不受欢迎的政策——正是那些好心的大学生说他们试图帮助的人——并导致;凶杀率更高;。

;

;《麻烦》不仅仅是一本引人入胜的回忆录，它还分析了困扰美国大学的有争议的信仰体系。但它并不是一篇愤怒的文化战争长篇大论。亨德森先生没有发表政治立场声明。他写的很多内容都是常识。这是美国大部分中产阶级所相信的。

;Across the world, ;dodgy elections are common;: at least 28 of the 76 countries holding ;elections this year; will not have a fully free and fair vote, according to ;EIU;, our sister company. Roughly a third of the world's countries are run by authoritarian regimes that hold flawed elections.独裁者利用它们来宣称合法性并奖励公民的忠诚。 They may secure victory by lying about the result, rigging the electoral system and media coverage in their favour, harassing the opposition, coercing voters or bribing them with handouts. How can genuine democracies respond to rigged elections—and does it make any difference?

;Foreign governments have few good options. Countries tend to recognise and co-operate with one another, regardless of ideological differences. Military intervention is risky and unpopular. America balks at sending troops into Haiti, a country in its backyard where gangs have, in effect, overthrown the government. ;ECOWAS;, a west African bloc, failed to agree on military action to restore democracy in Niger, where military leaders ;staged a coup; last year.

;

;Democracies may refuse to recognise the results of rigged elections.这是值得称赞的，但对独裁者的影响往往可以忽略不计，即使警告伴随着制裁。 In 2019 Western and South American democracies endorsed Juan Guiadó as Venezuela's interim president after Nicolás Maduro awarded himself another six-year term in a sham election. The sanctions they imposed on the country hurt ordinary Venezuelans. But because Mr Maduro controlled the army, he retained power. Mr Guaidó, who lives in America, is now largely irrelevant. In April he was kicked out of Colombia while trying to attend a conference on the future of Venezuela. America has in effect recognised Mr Maduro. Last year America agreed to ease sanctions on the country after it agreed to hold a free presidential election this year. That looks unlikely: Venezuela's top court has ;blocked opposition candidates; from running. In January America began reimposing sanctions.

;

;All too often foreign governments ignore dodgy electoral tactics. In 2019 an independent estimate said Martin Fayulu had won the Democratic Republic of Congo's presidential election with 60% of the vote. But the electoral commission claimed Félix Tshisekedi had won with 39%, a few points ahead of Mr Fayulu. America noted irregularities but recognised Mr Tshisekedi as president nonetheless. Accepting illegitimate elections has consequences. The West's reputation as a defender of democracy is wearing thin, just as democracy is becoming rarer and less popular. And recognising illegitimate rulers can damage democratic opposition movements.

;But I don't think voters can be certain just what this new Republican Party stands for, because, as Mr Trump demonstrated in the past few days, he remains such an opportunistic and transactional politician.他表示自己赞成“削减”权利，然后坚称自己不会做这样的事情，并扭转了自己作为总统的立场：在任期间，他发布了一项行政命令，禁止社交媒体应用程序 TikTok，如果其中国母公司字节跳动公司没有出售该应用程序的美国业务。但本周他反对众议院寻求相同结果的两党法案。;《经济学人》;;endorsed the bill; in this week's issue.

;Mr Trump explained that he wanted to combat a domestic adversary instead: “I don't want Facebook, which cheated in the last Election, doing better,” he wrote on his own social-media platform, Truth Social, with his odd, or maybe Germanic, capitalisation. “他们是真正的人民公敌！”后来，他提出了另一个政治理由：很多年轻人喜欢 TikTok。第三种可能性是，这位前总统正在向 TikTok 的亿万富翁投资者寻求捐款； Mr Trump has denied discussing the app with him. 
;
;Whatever his motive, or mix of motives, none speaks to protecting Americans' data or countering China.然而特朗普表示，他仍然认为 TikTok 是国家安全威胁。正是这种对目的和手段的不确定性，使得特朗普主义与里根主义不同，很难脱离特朗普本人来定义。特朗普自称支持堕胎，他能够任命足够多的法官来推翻罗伊诉韦德案，但他在堕胎问题上的立场最终会如何呢？ I wonder if he knows. 
;
;Despite having served a term Mr Trump still offers less a set of principles than a mush of private and public aspirations and interests.这是伟大的旧政党的一个松软的新基础。 The fact that House Republicans overwhelmingly ignored Mr Trump's opposition and supported the ban suggests that, while they may bow to him as their political champion, they do not take him as seriously when it comes to policy. Let's hope some can show similar sense when it comes to aid for Ukraine and other matters.

;;E;;ARLY VOTING; in Mariupol began on March 10th, courtesy of armed election brigades who criss-crossed the city in search of participants. Sometimes, mobile ;ballot boxes; were unveiled to the sounds of rousing hits such as Sergei Voitenko's “My Russia” (Russia! Russia! My Russia! / Great country! Motherland!).其他时候，枪支才是说话的。那些愿意等到正式开始的人的工作会更加困难。投票站的位置在投票前没有公布——官员们解释说，这一规定旨在确保组织者的安全。到 3 月 15 日晚（三个正式投票日中的第一个）投票结束时，该地区的投票率高达 69%。 This was all the more remarkable given the absence of accurate voting lists to calculate the number from.

;

;The vote in Mariupol could be written off as a farce, were it not for everything that went before it.投票的第二天恰好是在俄罗斯飞机向该市主要剧院投下炸弹的两年前，当时大量儿童正在里面避难，导致数百人死亡。地方当局估计，在数周的轰炸期间，该市至少有 22,000 名平民丧生。可能要多得多。 Only 120,000 of a pre-war population of 450,000 remain in Mariupol, plus a similar number of new migrants from Russia and central Asia.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Local sources, whose identities we are withholding for their protection, report that Mariupol has been unusually deserted over the days of the vote.他们说，这座城市仍然带有明显的战争伤痕。中央街道上有废墟，也有房屋已被清理的空坑。只有那些向俄罗斯占领军证明了自己价值的合作者才能在为数不多的新建建筑中获得住房，这些新建建筑是为城市边缘的摄像机而匆忙建造的。进出城市的通道仍然受到严格控制，进出道路上设有检查站。 Anyone wanting to enter has to get permission at Moscow's Sheremetyevo airport, 1,000 km away.

;

;The Kremlin has been nonetheless keen for Mariupol to display loyalty 。甚至在剧院被混凝土填充以遏制腐烂尸体的恶臭之前，占领军的第一个行动就是播放显示弗拉基米尔·普京(Vladimir Putin)的巨型视频屏幕。 “他们甚至没有开设商店、市场或医院，但他们有大型宣传屏幕，”一位当地人说。在总统选举前夕，开展了一场鼓励当地人持有俄罗斯护照的运动。 Its lack of success was perhaps most clearly shown in the decision in December 2023 to allow people to vote using their Ukrainian IDs, a rare example of a state allowing nationals of another one to take part in a presidential election. It is one of many avenues for voting fraud, suggests Mariupol's elected mayor Vadym Boychenko, now based in Ukrainian-controlled Dnipro.

;

;Solomiia Bobrovska, a member of Ukraine's parliamentary intelligence committee closely connected to resistance movements, says that Mariupol remains a partisan hotbed. “这就是为什么他们对这座城市如此严格。 They don't trust locals with anything important.”

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The resistance effort can broadly be split between military and civilian wings. Partisan and diversionary activity in the former category is overseen by agencies like the ;SSO;, Ukraine's special forces, and HUR, its military intelligence agency. The ;SBU;, the domestic intelligence outift, leads on civilian resistance.

;

;Alongside this are other more independent activist groups, like Yellow Ribbon, which says it has 15,000 activists across Ukraine's occupied territories.抵抗大多是低级别的：印刷反普京海报和组织地下乌克兰国旗制作。 Its social media channel offers suggestions about how to avoid voting and share information about election organisers with prosecutors. “It's about giving people support, to show they are not alone,” says “Alex,” a co-founder of the movement. “Our aim is to irritate the hell out of the Kremlin.”

;

;Civil and military representatives are hesitant to discuss the extent of their networks, but it's clear that their work has become much more difficult since the early days of the war.许多特工都受到了威胁，在最好的情况下甚至被关进监狱。俄罗斯已向被占领土派遣了数万名安全人员。同样在流亡中的马里乌波尔市市长顾问佩特罗·安德鲁先科(Petro Andryushchenko)承认抵抗运动“失去了太多人”，并建议乌克兰应该更加小心。他建议鼓励当地人投票，除非这样做是安全的；他说，抵制不可能改变任何事情，而且可能会引起危险的关注。 “鉴于我们的历史和控制水平，马里乌波尔的抵抗运动与其他地方不同。在这个阶段，我们需要考虑如何让人们活下去。 They are our stake.”

;

;The Ukrainian government, perhaps surprisingly, has not produced a unified position on what its citizens should do: take part in the electoral farce to avoid reprisals, or ignore it.这在一定程度上是由于权力走廊内部的分歧造成的。但这实际上是因为官员们很难承认马里乌波尔的解放现在看来遥不可及。流亡市长博伊琴科因在战争初期离开自己的城市而受到批评，对他来说，重点应该是帮助目前分散在乌克兰各地的约 20 万幸存者。 “我们是一个疏散的城市，一个流亡的民族。 But we haven't disappeared.” ;■;
